text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Sulina free trade zone administration will call auction on Oct 10 to lease land and buildings.
ADEVARUL
- Romanian businessmen's association and chamber of trade and industry of Romania work together to improve legislation in financial and fiscal sector.
- State Ownership Fund (FPS) privatised more than 2,500 state enterprises so far.
- Troubled Banca Dacia Felix SA submitted recovery plan to court in Cluj. In case court decides plan is not workable bank liquidation procedures will start.
- Opposition MPs asked parliament to postpone tender for GSM licences for after the November 3 presidential and parliamentary elections.
TINERETUL LIBER
- Bucharest city hall held tender for construction over next two and half years of thermoelectric plant in capital city. Successful bidder will be announced by end-October.
AZI
- FPS said foreign capital is needed in order to buy stakes in big Romanian companies slated for privatisation.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Romania's first nuclear power plant at Cernavoda is about to start commercial electricity production.
- U.S. food company McDonald's plans to open three restaurants in Transylvanian town of Sibiu.
General:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Journalists from independent newspapers discovered centre allegedly set-up by the ruling Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) to influence electorate in favour of PDSR.
- Opposition Democratic Convention (CD) is ready to forge alliances with democratic parties which accept its electoral programme, says CD leader Emil Constantinescu.
- Police arrested dangerous gang of thieves who operated in Bucharest over past months.
LIBERTATEA
- Association of former war veterans protested against decision by family of Nicu Ceausescu, late son of former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu, to wrap his coffin in Romania's tricolor flag at burial.
- Miron Cozma, leader of miners-led riots which unseated former premier Petre Roman in 1991, to run for a seat in Senate in November 3 parliamentary elections.
ADEVARUL

- Constantin Marinescu, self-proclaimed leader of unregistered Partidul Renasterea Romaniei has allegedly cheated scores of people by promising them money in exchange for votes in November elections, the paper says.
- Students have to pay bribes in hard currency to get accommodation in student hostels.
- Opposition Hungarian Democratic Union of Romania does not qualify for subsidies granted by the government to political parties.
- Bucharest hospitals reported new cases of meningitis.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Romanian and U.S. medical experts study causes behind meningitis epidemic which killed 40 people last month. -- Bucharest newsromm 40-1 3120264
